objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: Primary author and publisher of the report; also credited as the author in YARA rule metadata.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND C2
objects.description: Hardcoded default command-and-control IP used by UMBRELLA STAND over fake TLS on port 443.

objects.name: Hidden actor directory
objects.description: Hidden directory used by UMBRELLA STAND components to evade detection and stage tooling on Fortinet devices.

objects.name: First shell results file
objects.description: Per-execution results file created by UMBRELLA STAND’s first shell implementation for command output prior to exfiltration and deletion.

objects.name: Second shell collection info file
objects.description: INI file used by UMBRELLA STAND’s second shell implementation to track chunk collection state for executed commands.

objects.name: ldpreload persistence file
objects.description: System preload configuration abused by UMBRELLA STAND to achieve persistence by loading malicious library into new processes.

objects.name: libguic.so (loaded via ldpreload)
objects.description: Malicious shared object loaded via ldpreload to bootstrap UMBRELLA STAND components.

objects.name: Modified sysctl binary
objects.description: Legitimate Fortinet binary whose string references were altered by UMBRELLA STAND to hide the actor’s directory.

objects.name: Process name spoofing target
objects.description: Hardcoded fake executable path used by UMBRELLA STAND to impersonate process name in listings.

objects.name: Injected tooling log file
objects.description: Temporary log file path referenced by injected tooling associated with UMBRELLA STAND.

objects.name: Injected object (reboot_hooker candidate)
objects.description: Name/path of object injected into PID 1 via dskz; likely associated with the reboot hooking mechanism.

objects.name: Indicator for blghtd (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND networking binary responsible for C2 and tasking processing.

objects.name: Indicator for blghtd (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND networking binary responsible for C2 and tasking processing.

objects.name: Indicator for blghtd (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND networking binary responsible for C2 and tasking processing.

objects.name: Indicator for jvnlpe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND watchdog binary that starts and restarts blghtd.

objects.name: Indicator for jvnlpe (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND watchdog binary that starts and restarts blghtd.

objects.name: Indicator for jvnlpe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND watchdog binary that starts and restarts blghtd.

objects.name: Indicator for cisz (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND initialization and injection launcher component.

objects.name: Indicator for cisz (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND initialization and injection launcher component.

objects.name: Indicator for cisz (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND initialization and injection launcher component.

objects.name: Indicator for libguic.so (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of malicious library loaded via ldpreload to load cisz.

objects.name: Indicator for libguic.so (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of malicious library loaded via ldpreload to load cisz.

objects.name: Indicator for libguic.so (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of malicious library loaded via ldpreload to load cisz.

objects.name: Indicator for reboot_hooker (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND component that hooks device reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Indicator for reboot_hooker (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND component that hooks device reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND component that hooks device reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Indicator for a (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND file encryptor utility used by actors to AES encrypt/decrypt files.

objects.name: Indicator for a (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND file encryptor utility used by actors to AES encrypt/decrypt files.

objects.name: Indicator for a (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND file encryptor utility used by actors to AES encrypt/decrypt files.

objects.name: Indicator for lidwok (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of BusyBox multi-call binary deployed by actors to run shell commands.

objects.name: Indicator for tdp (MD5)

objects.name: Indicator for tdp (SHA1)

objects.name: Indicator for tdp (SHA256)

objects.name: Indicator for nbso (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of nbtscan utility deployed by actors for NetBIOS discovery.

objects.name: Indicator for nbso (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of nbtscan utility deployed by actors for NetBIOS discovery.

objects.name: Indicator for nbso (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of nbtscan utility deployed by actors for NetBIIOS discovery.

objects.name: umbrella stand
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND is a collection of actor binaries targeting Fortinet FortiGate 100D series firewalls. It enables remote shell execution, configurable beacon frequency and C2 IP, AES-encrypted C2 communications over fake TLS on port 443, and employs defense evasion including hidden directories, generic filenames, encrypted stack strings, process name spoofing (/bin/httpsd), ldpreload-based loading, and a reboot hook persistence mechanism. It uses components such as blghtd (networking/C2), jvnlpe (watchdog), cisz (initializer and injector launcher), libguic.so (ldpreload loader), and a reboot hooker injected into PID 1 (init). It supports commands for keep-alives, remote shell, reading files in chunks, registering the device, and runtime configuration of sleep and C2 IP. It abuses FortiOS protections by modifying sysctl behavior to hide /data2/.ztls/. Communications use AES-CBC with a fixed IV in the provided sample and a fake TLS header without a handshake. Actors deploy it alongside public tools including BusyBox, nbtscan, tcpdump, and likely OpenLDAP.

objects.name: shoe rack
objects.description: SHOE RACK is a previously unknown piece of malware identified on the same Fortinet device as UMBRELLA STAND. Its functionality is beyond the scope of the report; however, it is referenced as a potential avenue used by the actors to deploy additional tooling or facilitate file transfer.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: Vendor of FortiGate devices targeted by UMBRELLA STAND; the malware hooks Fortinet reboot functionality and abuses FortiOS file hiding mechanisms.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains functionality to receive and run Shell commands.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains AES-encrypted strings.

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses tooling to perform process injection.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND binaries had been deleted from the device.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Process Argument Spoofing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND modifies its process name.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling use hidden directories.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Kernel Modules and Extensions
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to modify reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to load via ldpreload.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND performs process discovery to check that its main process is still executing.

objects.name: Network Service Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with nbtscan which can list NetBIOS computer names.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with tcpdump which can be, and was, used to perform packet captures.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol or Service Impersonation
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses fake TLS for communications with the C2 server.

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
encrypted stack strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {C6 45 D0 92 C6 45 D1 48 C6 45 D2 D6 C6 45 D3 E3 C6 45
D4 39 C6 45 D5 EE C6 45 D6 CE C6 45 D7 E4 C6 45 D8 59 C6 45 D9 58
C6 45 DA 97 C6 45 DB E5 C6 45 DC 2E C6 45 DD 27 C6 45 DE 98 C6 45
DF DE C6 45 E0 93 C6 45 E1 A8 C6 45 E2 77 C6 45 E3 9B C6 45 E4 4A
C6 45 E5 F0 C6 45 E6 EF C6 45 E7 74 C6 45 E8 80 C6 45 E9 2D C6 45
EA EB C6 45 EB 30 C6 45 EC 1F C6 45 ED B5 C6 45 EE D9 C6 45 EF C7}
// Key
        $ = {C6 45 C0 77 C6 45 C1 90 C6 45 C2 3D C6 45 C3 35 C6 45
C4 A4 C6 45 C5 9F C6 45 C6 0F C6 45 C7 5E C6 45 C8 F5 C6 45 C9 52
C6 45 CA 44 C6 45 CB 69 C6 45 CC B9 C6 45 CD C0 C6 45 CE BA C6 45
CF DC} // IV
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings, if string obfuscation is not present."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {ED B8 83 20}
        $ = "%s/%d.sv"
        $ = "%s/%s.ini"
        $ = "%s>%s 2>&1"
        $ = "%[^=]=%[^=]"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/"
        $ = "/proc/%s/status"
        $ = "%*s %s"
        $ = "./lidwok killall blghtd"
        $ = "89.44.194.32"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/lidwok"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        5 of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings present in tooling."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "LoadMsg"
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "error"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
custom base64 alphabet and encryption key reference."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:

        $ = ",((@=+utivp45ztvo6&RFvt&*^tp&!q;"
        $ =
"ef345FGHIJKLMNOPWghijklmnoXYd67TUVABC89+/pqrstQRSDEZabcuvwxyz012"

    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "dxumbsu"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "loadMsg"
        $ ="/SYSV64564856"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings used to configure injection."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/SYSV64564856"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "version 2"
        $ = "init_drivercheck"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Umbrella Stand
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. umbrella stand.
